subject: RE: [junit] Running a test under two different runners.
msgSnippet: I can t think of a built in way. However, I think you could write a compound runner that would take a list of runners. Now I m curious, but I don t have time

I can't think of a built in way. However, I think you could write a compound
runner that would take a list of runners. Now I'm curious, but I don't have
time to program it at the moment.
 
Good luck,
 
Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
kelvsyc
Sent: Friday, April 11, 2008 5:23 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Running a test under two different runners.



Suppose I have a test class, which I want to run with two different
Runners. How would I do so without having to duplicate the test class
(such that each copy has a different RunWith annotation)?
